snippet.textDisplay:
I didn't play this game when I was a kid, so I have to pose this question: Were any of you horrified by this music when you were a kid playing this, or did the subtext just go over your head? 

Because this is legitimately scary and it matches the dark lighting of the levels perfectly. It sounds like you're one breath away from drowning.
snippet.textOriginal:
I didn't play this game when I was a kid, so I have to pose this question: Were any of you horrified by this music when you were a kid playing this, or did the subtext just go over your head? 

Because this is legitimately scary and it matches the dark lighting of the levels perfectly. It sounds like you're one breath away from drowning.

snippet.textDisplay: Yup, this theme scared me as a kid. But the worst part for me was in DKC2 when you need to run away from the giant bee as Rambi. I had a lot of nightmares about that.
snippet.textOriginal: Yup, this theme scared me as a kid. But the worst part for me was in DKC2 when you need to run away from the giant bee as Rambi. I had a lot of nightmares about that.

snippet.textDisplay: Great question. All my dkc horror nightmares was in 2. Specifically gloomy gulch. By the time I came to a complete water level in this game I used to the dkc shenanigans.
snippet.textOriginal: Great question. All my dkc horror nightmares was in 2. Specifically gloomy gulch. By the time I came to a complete water level in this game I used to the dkc shenanigans.

snippet.textDisplay: to be honest i was always amazed and enlightened by DKC musics i use to play the whole game with my mouth opened so no terror just amazed
snippet.textOriginal: to be honest i was always amazed and enlightened by DKC musics i use to play the whole game with my mouth opened so no terror just amazed

snippet.textDisplay:
The only scary dream I had as a kid about DKC was the game over screen appearing in me and my older cousin's room in the dark. Donkey Kong and Diddy Kong were on the top bunk crying and shaking.

It was one of those dreams that were scary but still made you want to cry inside.
snippet.textOriginal:
The only scary dream I had as a kid about DKC was the game over screen appearing in me and my older cousin's room in the dark. Donkey Kong and Diddy Kong were on the top bunk crying and shaking.

It was one of those dreams that were scary but still made you want to cry inside.

snippet.textDisplay: The variety between the water level tracks in the DKC games is just perfect. In DKC1, there's Aquatic Ambiance, which is the really peaceful, relaxing one. In DKC2, there's Lockjaw's Saga, the exciting, action-like one. And then in this game, DKC3, there's this, Water World, the creepy, dark one. I'm actually having a hard time choosing which is my favorite because of the variety. I love the soundtracks of all the DKC games. And I mean all of them. Even DKC3 SNES and GBA, Returns, and especially Tropical Freeze. David Wise and Eveline Novakovic have so much talent.
snippet.textOriginal: The variety between the water level tracks in the DKC games is just perfect. In DKC1, there's Aquatic Ambiance, which is the really peaceful, relaxing one. In DKC2, there's Lockjaw's Saga, the exciting, action-like one. And then in this game, DKC3, there's this, Water World, the creepy, dark one. I'm actually having a hard time choosing which is my favorite because of the variety. I love the soundtracks of all the DKC games. And I mean all of them. Even DKC3 SNES and GBA, Returns, and especially Tropical Freeze. David Wise and Eveline Novakovic have so much talent.

snippet.textDisplay: @Mephistobr It depends. DKC1 had 3 composers DKC2 had only one and DKC3 had 2. Being that David Wise is the main composer behind DKC soundtracks (specially DKC2), Eveline Novakovik composed some of DKC1 and 3 soundtracks, such as the amazing Nothern Hemispheres (snow level) from DKC1
snippet.textOriginal: @Mephistobr It depends. DKC1 had 3 composers DKC2 had only one and DKC3 had 2. Being that David Wise is the main composer behind DKC soundtracks (specially DKC2), Eveline Novakovik composed some of DKC1 and 3 soundtracks, such as the amazing Nothern Hemispheres (snow level) from DKC1

snippet.textDisplay:
I just got the weirdest flashback.

I literally saw myself in my 7 yr old self tryin my best to swim away from a snappin fish and finding KONG pieces and DK barrels.

I always used to rush thru these levels, cause the music blended in so well with the environment, and i always used to get scared and start cryin an shit.

Nearly 10 years have passed. Im not scared anymore, but i still shed a tear.....good times

You're probably thinking of the DS' 3D capabilities.

The DS shoudl be able to use the SNES sprites and artwork and make it look just the same as it would on the SNES.

In my opinion, I'd love to see a DKC compilation on the DS, though I do agree the Wii might be a better choice.
